revised_title: Observations on the Structure and Transparency of the Crystalline Humor of the Eye
tldr: The author examines the structure and composition of the crystalline humor of the eye, discovering that it is composed of thin, thread-like structures and globules. He also observes that the crystalline humor is highly transparent, allowing light to pass through in straight lines. The author provides a detailed description of the structure and compares it to a tennis ball wrapped with a fine cord, representing the complexity and transparency of the eye's crystalline humor.
